subNodes.conversationText: root

Lennil is the middle of hurridly gathering his belongings when you burst into his hut. He turns to face you, spilling clothes and small golden trinkets on the floor.

"I knew I couldn't trust you! We had a deal, a simple bloody deal, and you've gone and ruined it!"
"The deal's off, Lennil. I changed my mind."

"Yeah, I worked that out when I heard you carving your way through the camp."

Lennil gestures around him at the gold trinkets. "Look, keep my stuff. Its valuable. And Winvale's all yours as well. I just want to get out of here. You're... you're not going to attack an unarmed man, are you? Come on, let me slip out of here." 

He shudders." Believe me, I'm not going to be looking back any time soon."
"Leave the trinkets and get out of here, Lennil. If I see you again, you'll regret it."
Lennil breathes a huge sigh of relief. "I have to say, I wasn't expecting that. You're a very decent sort." Wasting no more time, he slips out of the hut, leaving you alone with Winvale.
Speak to Winvale

You crouch down next to Winvale. He is clearly in a lot of pain, bleeding profusely and covered in sweat. Flies are starting to settle on him. You brush them aside, and they rise in the air like a small black cloud.

His eyes bulge when he sees you. "You... you're not with Kirkmor?"
"No. Serl Dorian sent me."

Winvale grabs your wrist suddenly, pulling you closer. He has surprising strength.

"I didn't tell him. Tell Dorian, I didn't tell him!"
"You didn't tell him what?"

Winvale collapses back onto the floor. His eyes see straight past you. 

"There is a secret word to pass through the main temple doors," he whispers. "Sevantis. You need to say, "Sevantis"."
"Does Kirkmor know?"

"I didn't tell him," Winvale grins. "He stuck his knife in me, but I didn't tell. As much as he hurt me, I didn't tell. I didn't tell Lennil anything."

His eyes close and his breathing slows.
There's nothing more you can do here. Leave him.

As you turn to leave, Winvale's eyes suddenly bulge open again and he grabs your wrist urgently. 

"The Vandrid!" he whispers hoarsely. "The Elderin didn't know. Don't believe its lies!"
"The Vandrid? What's a Vandrid?"
It is too late. Winvale has slumped down back onto the floor and his breathing has stilled, his pain now over. Whatever he intended to tell you will remain a mystery.
Continue
"You threw your lot in with bandits. Now face the consequences!"
Lennil's eyes widen at the sight of the staff. "You did it! You killed those nuisance druids! I must say, I'm impressed. I had you down as a weak bunch of fools."
"Here's the staff. I expect you to uphold your end of the bargain."

"Of course. I am a man of my word, you can be sure of that! Gerrin Winvale is all yours." Lennil looks a little pained. "Although I'm afraid he's... well, he isn't very well. He doesn't have long to last, truth be told. I suggest you make the most of your time with him. But anyway, he's all yours, for what its worth."
Continue

Lennil pauses, holding the staff thoughtfully.

"Actually, friend, this doesn't look right to me. Not right at all."
[Persuade] "Its genuine. I killed the Druids and took it from their cold fingers."

Lennil snorts, but studies the staff closer.

"Well," he says finally. "I suppose you did. The staff isn't quite how I remembered it, that's all. Very well, Winvale is all yours."
Speak to Winvale

You crouch down next to Winvale. He is clearly in a lot of pain, bleeding profusely and covered in sweat. Flies are starting to settle on him. You brush them aside, and they rise in the air like a small black cloud.

His eyes bulge when he sees you. "You... you're not with Kirkmor?"
Lennil's eyes widen at the sight of the staff. "You did it! You killed those nuisance druids! I must say, I'm impressed. I had you down as a weak bunch of fools."
"Here's the staff. I expect you to uphold your end of the bargain."

"Of course. I am a man of my word, you can be sure of that. Gerrin Winvale is all yours." Lennil looks a little pained. "Although I'm afraid he's... well, he isn't very well. He doesn't have long to last, truth be told. I suggest you make the most of your time with him. But he's all yours, for what its worth."
Speak to Winvale

You crouch down next to Winvale. He is clearly in a lot of pain, bleeding profusely and covered in sweat. Flies are starting to settle on him. You brush them aside, and they rise in the air like a small black cloud.

His eyes bulge when he sees you. "You... you're not with Kirkmor?"
"No. Serl Dorian sent me."

Winvale grabs your wrist suddenly, pulling you closer. He has surprising strength.

"I didn't tell him. Tell Dorian, I didn't tell him!"
"You didn't tell him what?"

Winvale collapses back onto the floor. His eyes see straight past you. 

"There is a secret word to pass through the main temple doors," he whispers. "Sevantis. You need to say, "Sevantis"."
"Does Kirkmor know?"

"I didn't tell anyone," Winvale grins. "Lennil stuck his knife in me, but I didn't tell. As much as he hurt me, I didn't tell. I didn't tell him anything."

His eyes close and his breathing slows.
There's nothing more you can do here. Leave him.

As you turn to leave, Winvale's eyes suddenly bulge open again and he grabs your wrist urgently. 

"The Vandrid!" he whispers hoarsely. "The Elderin didn't know. Don't believe its lies!"
"The Vandrid? What's a Vandrid?"
It is too late. Winvale has slumped down back onto the floor and his breathing has stilled, his pain now over. Whatever he intended to tell you will remain a mystery.
Continue
"Well, our business is done here. Kindly leave my camp."
Continue

You enter a large hut. Facing you is a tall, lithe man wearing a blue robe. 

At the back of the hut you see the King's archaeologist, Gerrin Winvale, stretched out on a bloody mattress and clutching a deep wound in his side. He is covered in sweat and shaking feverishly.

"Ahhh," says the man in the blue robe nervously. "Visitors."
Continue

"I heard you carving your way through the camp. Very impressive. I didn't expect you to get this far in all honesty, although we're a bit short on numbers since Kirkmor set off to find that bloody temple. I don't suppose you... I don't suppose you left any of them alive, did you?" 

He sees the look on your face and sighs. "Ahh, no. I suppose not."
"Who are you?"

"My name is Lennil." He gives you a short bow. "I'm a man of no importance, really. I do a bit of running for Kirkmor, here and there, as he asks. I don't have any grand plans or ambitions, except to survive the day." He licks his lips. "Now, that is an ambition worth having."
"You work for Kirkmor?"

"Oh yes," Lennil shudders. "Awful man, really. I never took to him. He's very good at bullying the men though. You know; keeping them in line, and all that. He's been spending most of his time in Blackwinter recently with some new gang, I wasn't all that pleased to see him back to be honest with you."
"Where is he?"

"He's on an expedition. Something about a lost temple, but I didn't ask too many questions. We have a pet wizard called Axin who might have more information. He's in the camp still somewhere. Although I guess that means you've probably killed him by now?" Lennil licks his lips nervously. "Yes, well. Can't say I blame you, of course."
Continue
"Believe me, whatever Kirkmor is up to, he's better left to it. I wouldn't go intentionally looking to put myself in his way."
"I've come for Gerrin Winvale. Step aside."

"Ahh, yes. Of course. I'm not going to stand in your way. But I'm afraid it isn't looking too good for him."  Lennil looks a little pained. "Not my doing, you understand. The fellows were a bit rough capturing him. He got stabbed. I don't think he has too long left."
"Stand aside now!"

"Of course, of course!" 

Lennil licks his lips. "Look, would you mind awfully if I just slipped out and left you to it? I don't really have any great intention of dying here if I can help it. And I can't really offer you any help or anything. I'd just like to get out of here and go home."
"Very well."

Lennil's face floods with relief. "Well, that really is very big of you. Can't thank you enough. Good luck and all that. And sorry about your man Winvale. Really wasn't anything to do with me, I swear."

He darts out of the door. You hear his footsteps vanishing into the distance.
Speak to Winvale

You crouch down next to Winvale. He is clearly in a lot of pain, bleeding profusely and covered in sweat. Flies are starting to settle on him. You brush them aside, and they rise in the air like a small black cloud.

His eyes bulge when he sees you. "You... you're not with Kirkmor?"
"I can't let you live, Lennil. You've been preying on the weak!"
"Ah yes, I guess I have. But I'm weak, no? What would you gain from killing me? Come, let me slip out and I'll never bother you again. I swear it!"
"Very well. Get out of here, Lennil."

Lennil's face floods with relief. "Well, that really is very big of you. Can't thank you enough. Good luck and all that. And sorry about your man Winvale. Really wasn't anything to do with me, I swear."

He darts out of the door. You hear his footsteps vanishing into the distance.
Speak to Winvale

You crouch down next to Winvale. He is clearly in a lot of pain, bleeding profusely and covered in sweat. Flies are starting to settle on him. You brush them aside, and they rise in the air like a small black cloud.

His eyes bulge when he sees you. "You... you're not with Kirkmor?"
"Show some dignity in death, man!"
"Ahhh, dammit! You idiots are relentless!" Lennil throws up his hands in frustration, and then lunges at you with a wicked looking dagger.
Continue
"Shut up and prepare to die!"

"Ah, no! No, really, there's no need for that. I'm not really in charge around here. Truth be told, that's Kirkmor. And he's not even here. Come on now, there's no point killing me, is there? How about you let me slip out and vanish off back home? You'll never see me again, I swear!"
"Very well. Get out of my sight."

The man's face floods with relief. "Well, that really is very big of you. Can't thank you enough. Good luck and all that. And sorry about your man Winvale. Really wasn't anything to do with me, I swear."

He darts out of the door. You hear his footsteps vanishing into the distance.
Speak to Winvale

You crouch down next to Winvale. He is clearly in a lot of pain, bleeding profusely and covered in sweat. Flies are starting to settle on him. You brush them aside, and they rise in the air like a small black cloud.

His eyes bulge when he sees you. "You... you're not with Kirkmor?"
"You threw your lot in with bandits. Now face the consequences!"
"Ahhh, dammit! You idiots are relentless!" Lennil throws up his hands in frustration, and then lunges at you with a wicked looking dagger.
"Where is Kirkmor?"

"He's on an expedition. Something about a lost temple, but I didn't ask too many questions. We have a pet wizard called Axin who might have more information. He's in the camp still somewhere. Although I guess that means you've probably killed him by now?" Lennil licks his lips nervously. "Yes, well. Can't say I blame you, of course."

You enter a large hut. At the back of the hut you see the King's archaeologist, Gerrin Winvale, stretched out on a bloody mattress and clutching a deep wound in his side. He is covered in sweat and shaking feverishly. Standing before him is a tall, lithe man wearing a blue robe. 

"Ahhh," the man in the blue robe sneers. "Visitors."
Continue
"A dwarf? A bloody dwarf climbed over my bloody wall? I'll have those useless guards flogged until their skin is hanging off!"
"Are you in charge here?"
"Let me guess. You climbed over the fence somehow? Those bloody guards are useless. I'll have them flogged until their skin is hanging off!"
"Are you in charge here?"
Lennil eyes narrow. "No. Kirkmor's in charge. Although he isn't here right now."
"Where did Kirkmor go?"
Lennil shrugs. "None of your business, frankly. Now, let's talk. It seems to me that you have a problem."
"I have a problem? There's only one of you!"

"Ah, yes. But if I shout then the entire camp will come pouring in through that door. Can you fight the entire camp? I very much doubt it. You'd get slaughtered. So tell me what you want and maybe I'll let you live."
"I've come for Gerrin Winvale."

"What, him?" Lennil glances at his groaning prisoner. "You're welcome to him. I've been sticking my knife into him all day trying to find out what he knows about that bloody cursed temple Kirkmor seems so interested in. He claims to be an archaeologist, but I don't think he actually knows anything. He's useless."
"So I can take him and leave? Just like that?"
"Well, not quite. If you want him, you still need to pay for him." Lennil reflects. "Do a job for me, and he's yours."
"What's the job?"

"There's a group of druids to the north who are causing me problems. They don't like that we cut down part of the forest for our camp, and they don't like our boats either." Lennil reflects for a moment. "To be honest, they just don't like us."

"Deal with them and bring me their leader's staff, and you can have your man and leave with your lives."
"Deal with the druids and bring you their leader's staff. Got it."
"Good <boy/girl>," Lennil grins. "Now go get me that staff."
"I'm not cutting a deal with you, Lennil!"
Lennil shrugs. "You won't get out of here alive unless you do."
"I said no deal. And I meant it."
"WE'RE UNDER ATTACK!" Lennil bellows, and lunges at you with a wicked looking dagger and a shriek of rage.
"Ok. I guess I don't have much choice. It's a deal."
"Good <boy/girl>," Lennil grins. "Now go get me that staff."
Continue
"No. I can't let you live, Lennil."
"WE'RE UNDER ATTACK!" Lennil bellows, and lunges at you with a wicked looking dagger and a shriek of rage.
"Bring it on! You'll pay for your crimes now!"
"WE'RE UNDER ATTACK!" Lennil bellows, and lunges at you with a wicked looking dagger and a shriek of rage.
Continue
"Shut up and prepare to die!"
Lennil snorts and holds up his hand. "Not so fast, you big plumb. You have a problem."
"I have a problem? There's only one of you!"
